page.title: 10BL Technology
page.content: BRITISH LEYLAND TECHNOLOGY - PROVING GROUND This was a military airfield from 1942 to 1972. It has been used as a passenger car testing ground since 1979. The cars are not yet for the market so they try to screen them from the public. The land falls away to the SE and NW which gives poor visibility from surrounding roads but they have also built a 2.5 m high fence along the 13km perimeter and mounds in areas close to houses and roads. Earth for these mounds was taken from places on site which then gave the ups and downs necessary for testing vehicles but not present on airfields. 300 buildings were demolished and the rest refurbished for workshops and offices.
